com.google.common.io

Class ByteBufferDataOutputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.OutputStream
      • com.google.common.io.ByteBufferDataOutputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, DataOutput, Flushable, AutoCloseable

    public class ByteBufferDataOutputStream
extends OutputStream
implements DataOutput
    Wrapper from ByteBuffer to an OutputStream and the DataOutput interface, converting unchecked exceptions from underlying ByteBuffer calls to appropriate checked IOExceptions. In particular, an overflow of the buffer will result in an EOFException being thrown (which is not normally thrown by DataOutputStream).

    The byte ordering used depends on the ordering set by ByteBuffer.order(java.nio.ByteOrder). If that is explicitly set to ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN, that will be the ordering of written values spanning more than one byte.

    While useful for typical memory buffers, this may be especially useful for MappedByteBuffer instances.

    This class was taken from http://code.google.com/p/guava-libraries/issues/detail?id=592.

    Author:
    Todd Vierling
